sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of entertainment outcome occurring in a performance.
message_1: In a magic show, a magician has a pack of 52 cards, out of which 4 cards are Ace of Hearts. If the magician shuffles the deck and selects a card at random, what is the probability that the selected card will be Ace of Hearts?
message_2:
There is an error in the problem statement. A standard deck of 52 cards has only 1 Ace of Hearts. Assuming it is a standard deck, the probability of selecting the Ace of Hearts would be:

Number of favorable outcomes (selecting Ace of Hearts) = 1
Total number of possible outcomes (total cards in the deck) = 52

Probability = (Number of favorable outcomes) / (Total number of possible outcomes)
Probability = 1 / 52
